channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A rivalry that predates the Civil War is about to heat up with a vote on subsidizing a new stadium
item.description: The Kansas Legislature's top leaders endorsed helping the Chiefs and professional baseball's Kansas City Royals finance new stadiums in Kansas ahead of a special session set to convene Tuesday.

item.title: Israeli military announces 'tactical pause' in attempt to increase flow of aid into hard-hit Gaza
item.description: The army said the pause would begin in the Rafah area at 8 a.m. (0500 GMT, 1 a.m. eastern) and remain in effect until 7 p.m. (1600 GMT, noon eastern).

item.title: Why the Supreme Court’s Starbucks ruling likely won’t stop workers unionizing
A rare flesh-eating bacteria with a 'terrifying' mortality rate that can kill people in 48 hours is spreading in Japan
item.description: “As soon as a patient notices swelling in foot in the morning, it can expand to the knee by noon, and they can die within 48 hours.”

item.title: I dropped out of a group vacation—do I still have to pay for the hotel?: Tips from travel experts
item.description: When planning or opting out of a group trip it's best to be over communicative.

item.title: French banks' bonds buckle as Paris awaits snap elections
Meet the co-owner of the NBA's Dallas Mavericks: A casino mogul trying to bring gambling to a reluctant state
item.description: “The NBA is a multifaceted business. It’s a media business, a hospitality business and a culinary business. It’s all about experience."

item.title: This ETF uses a profitability overlay to deliver durable returns. Here's how it works
item.description: A top exchange-traded fund provider is screening diversified value stocks for long-term gains.

item.title: Apple’s stock led the Dow this week — and could see more momentum ahead
Colliding hot and cold fronts whipsaw the U.S. with extreme heat, flooding, and a chance of snow
item.description: While most of the country bakes, parts of Montana have been placed under winter storm watches with a potential for wet snow Monday night.

item.title: We live 'the California dream' in a 940-sq-ft trailer by the beach for $5,100 a month
item.description: "We couldn't be happier here," says Jaclyn Westlake. "We've been in this home for two years now and we don't plan on moving anytime soon."

item.title: What Wells Fargo’s ‘mouse-jiggler’ scandal says about the problem with work now
U.S. debt could threaten the economic growth that's needed to keep the burden sustainable, former IMF official says
item.description: "Even absent this dire scenario, meeting additional interest obligations as the debt ratio rises could require the federal government to cut discretionary spending, with negative implications for economic growth."

item.title: A nutritionist shares 2 unusual tips to get the most benefit from immunity-boosting foods
item.description: It's not only what you eat but how you eat it, too. Here are tips from a nutritionist about how to get the most nutrients from foods for an immunity boost.

item.title: Dow logs longest losing streak in 2 months, S&P 500 pulls back from record highs
